@andy721

RCT3 Requirements
Operating System: Mac OS X 10.3.9
CPU Processor: PowerPC G4/G5
CPU Speed: 1GHz (1.2GHz recommended)
Memory: 256 MB or higher (512 MB recommended)
Hard Disk Space: 2.0 GB free disk space
Video Card (ATI): Radeon 9000
Video Card (NVidia): GeForce FX5200
Video Memory (VRam): 32 MB or higher
Media Required: DVD Drive
http://www.aspyr.com/product/game_specs/9

Current MacBook Pro Specs (the basic MBP at that)
2.4GHz Intel Core 2 Duo
2GB (two SO-DIMMs) 667MHz DDR2 memory (PC2-5300)
NVIDIA GeForce 8600M GT with 256MB of GDDR3 memory and dual-link DVI
http://support.apple.com/specs/macbookpro/MacBook_Pro_Early_2008.html

The MacBook Pro is more than capable of running just about whatever one would like it to run. If a person wanted to, the MBP can have a 2.5GHz C2D, 4 Gigs of RAM, and a 512 MB vid card. The problem that MBP users are having with this game is that it is for POWER PC processors. That problem would exists in a Mac Pro as well (seeing as they run Intel Xeon Processors). There are patches to help, but if a person want this game to run well they need to have an old Mac or get an Intel (or universal) version of the game. 
Next time when you feel like insulting people and talking out of your asshole, perhaps you should check the facts. jerkass.

This game works fine on Intel Macs running OSX 10.5.  Don't install the Aspyr patch, it'll make the game unplayable.  If you want to listen to your own tunes while playing (and really why would you want to listen to the lame soundtrack in RTC3), just have iTunes play something, and turn the game music all the way down inside the option page. If you're trying to run this with an Intel Mac, you'll need to run it under Rosetta:
Right-click on the application icon and click "Get Info" -> Check the box beside "Run under Rosetta". This should fix some of your problems.
